data_columns.name: Reporting_Airline
data_columns.comment: Unique Carrier Code. When the same code has been used by multiple carriers, a numeric suffix is used for earlier users, for example, PA, PA(1), PA(2). Use this field for analysis across a range of years.

data_columns.name: OriginAirportID
data_columns.comment: Origin Airport, Airport ID. An identification number assigned by US DOT to identify a unique airport.  Use this field for airport analysis across a range of years because an airport can change its airport code and airport codes can be reused.

data_columns.name: DestAirportID
data_columns.comment: Destination Airport, Airport ID. An identification number assigned by US DOT to identify a unique airport.  Use this field for airport analysis across a range of years because an airport can change its airport code and airport codes can be reused.

data_columns.name: DepDelay
data_columns.comment: Difference in minutes between scheduled and actual departure time. Early departures show negative numbers.

data_columns.name: DepTime
data_columns.comment: Actual Departure Time (local time: hhmm), as a four-digit integer

data_columns.name: ArrDelay
data_columns.comment: Difference in minutes between scheduled and actual arrival time. Early arrivals show negative numbers.

data_columns.name: ArrTime
data_columns.comment: Actual Arrival Time (local time: hhmm), as a four-digit integer
